comments: a(n) is the coefficient of the closed form for BarnesG[(2n-1)/2].a(n) is the hook product corresponding to the partition (n,n-1,...,2,1). a(n)=(n(n+1)/2)!/A005118(n+1). - _Emeric Deutsch_, May 21 2004Hankel transform of A185998. - _Paul Barry_, Feb 08 2011
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..35
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Barnes G-Function
formula: a(n) = Product_{k=0..n} (2*k+1)^(n-k).a(n) ~ A^(1/2) * 2^(n^2/2+n+5/24) * n^(n^2/2+n/2+1/24) / exp(3*n^2/4+n/2+1/24), where A = 1.2824271291... is the Glaisher-Kinkelin constant (see A074962). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Nov 13 2014a(n) = 2^(n*(n+1)/2-1/24) * A^(3/2) * Pi^(-n/2-1/4) * exp(-1/8) * G(n+3/2), where A is the Glaisher-Kinkelin constant, G is the Barnes G-function. - _Vladimir Reshetnikov_, Nov 06 2015
maple: a:= n-> mul((2*k+1)^(n-k), k=0..n):seq(a(n), n=0..15);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 28 2012
mathematica: a[n_] := Product[2^i Gamma[1/2+i]/Sqrt[Pi], {i, n}]Table[Product[(2*k+1)^(n-k),{k,0,n}],{n,0,10}] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Nov 13 2014 *)Table[Product[(2k-1)!!,{k,1,n}],{n,0,10}] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Nov 13 2014 *)Table[2^(n(n+1)/2-1/24) Glaisher^(3/2) Pi^(-n/2-1/4) E^(-1/8) BarnesG[n+3/2], {n, 0, 10}] (* _Vladimir Reshetnikov_, Nov 06 2015 *)
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
extensions: Definition and programs corrected by _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Nov 13 2014
